snippet: Federal officials have faced criticism that they have failed to respond to accusations of abuse by agents.
abstract: Department of Homeland Security official R Gil Kerlikowske says federal border security officials, who have been sharply criticized for failing to respond to accusations of abuse by border agents, have new authority to conduct criminal investigations of claims of excessive force or corruption by those agents.
lead_paragraph: Federal officials have faced criticism that they have failed to respond to accusations of abuse by agents.

headline.main: Border Agency Is Authorized to Open Criminal Inquiries
headline.print_headline: Border Agency Is Authorized to Open Criminal Inquiries
